snippet: A grand jury indicted the governor of Texas on two felony counts in an investigation examining his handling of a local district attorney’s drunken driving arrest and the state financing for a public corruption unit under the lawyer’s control.
abstract: Grand jury indicts Texas Gov Rick Perry on two felony counts of abusing his official capacity and coercing a public servant; say he abused his power in 2013 when he tried to pressure Rosemary Lehmberg, a Democratic district attorney, to step down by threatening to cut off state financing for her office; indictment makes Perry the first Texas governor in nearly 100 years to face criminal charges and presents a major roadblock to his presidential ambitions.
lead_paragraph: A grand jury indicted the governor of Texas on two felony counts in an investigation examining his handling of a local district attorney’s drunken driving arrest and the state financing for a public corruption unit under the lawyer’s control.

headline.main: Gov. Rick Perry of Texas Is Indicted on Charge of Abuse of Power
headline.print_headline: Texas Governor Indicted in Case Alleging Abuses
